text: Trent Franks (born June 19, 1957) is a former American politician and businessman. He was the U.S. representative for from 2003 to 2017. He is a member of the Republican Party. In December 2017, the House Ethics Committee announced that it would investigate allegations of sexual harassment against Franks. Franks had repeatedly asked two female staffers to have his children as surrogate mothers. After he resigned on December 7, 2017, U.S. Speaker Paul Ryan said the investigation found the claims to be "credible". ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:United States representatives from Arizona Category:Politicians from Colorado Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from Arizona Category:Businesspeople from Colorado
title: Trent Franks
